BusinessName.BusinessNameLine2Txt: C/O LUTHERAN SOCIAL SERVICES OF ILLINOIS

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: RESPONDING TO THE GOSPEL, THE CORNERSTONE FOUNDATION IS THE ENDOWMENT ENSURING THE MINISTRIES AND FUTURE OF LUTHERAN SOCIAL SERVICES OF ILLINOIS (LSSI). THE CORNERSTONE FOUNDATION IS RESPONSIBLE FOR DEVELOPING ACTIVE SUPPORT FOR THE SOCIAL SERVICES PROVIDED BY LSSI.
IRS990.MissionDesc: RESPONDING TO THE GOSPEL, THE CORNERSTONE FOUNDATION IS THE ENDOWMENT ENSURING THE MINISTRIES AND FUTURE OF LUTHERAN SOCIAL SERVICES OF ILLINOIS (LSSI). THE CORNERSTONE FOUNDATION IS RESPONSIBLE FOR DEVELOPING ACTIVE SUPPORT FOR THE SOCIAL SERVICES PROVIDED BY LSSI. LSSI TOUCHES THE LIVES OF TENS OF THOUSANDS OF PEOPLE EACH YEAR, SERVING PEOPLE OF ALL AGES, RACES, RELIGIOUS, AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES. LSSI HAS MORE THAN 190 PROGRAMS AT MORE THAN 80 SITES IN THE STATE OF ILLINOIS. THESE PROGRAMS CARE FOR SENIOR ADULTS, STRENGTHEN FAMILIES, HELP CHILDREN AND ADULTS DURING TIMES OF CRISIS, AND ASSIST THOSE WHO HAVE CHALLENGES RELATED TO DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES OR ADDICTION PROBLEMS.
IRS990.Desc: LUTHERAN SOCIAL SERVICES OF ILLINOIS PROGRAM SERVICE GRANTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CORNERSTONE FOUNDATION'S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF APPROXIMATELY 40 INDIVIDUAL FUNDS ESTABLISHED FOR A VARIETY OF PURPOSES. ITS ENDOWMENT INCLUDES BOTH DONOR-RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS AND FUNDS DESIGNATED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES TO FUNCTION AS ENDOWMENTS.

THE CORNERSTONE FOUNDATION IS THE ENDOWMENT ENSURING THE MINISTRIES AND FUTURE OF LUTHERAN SOCIAL SERVICES OF ILLINOIS (LSSI). THE CORNERSTONE FOUNDATION BOARD IS RESPONSIBLE FOR DEVELOPING ACTIVE SUPPORT FOR THE SOCIAL SERVICES PROVIDED BY LSSI. THE FOUNDATION BOARD APPROVES THE DOLLAR AMOUNT OF DISTRIBUTIONS TO BE MADE FROM ENDOWMENT FUNDS IN SUPPORT OF LSSI'S PROGRAMS. REPORTS ARE PROVIDED TO THE FOUNDATION BOARD AND ARE REVIEWED AT ITS MEETINGS AS TO THE DOLLAR AMOUNTS DISTRIBUTED FROM EACH OF THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS AND WHAT PROGRAMS WERE THE RECIPIENTS OF THESE FUNDS.

ALL OFFICERS ARE EMPLOYEES OF LUTHERAN SOCIAL SERVICES OF ILLINOIS (LSSI), A RELATED ORGANIZATION. LSSI USES THE FOLLOWING METHODS TO ESTABLISH THE COMPENSATION OF THE CEO: COMPENSATION COMMITTEE; WRITTEN EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT; AND APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OR COMPENSATION COMMITTEE.
MARK STUTRUD, CEO OF LSSI, IS ENTITLED TO BENEFITS UNDER A 457F PLAN MAINTAINED BY LSSI. DURING FY18, NO AMOUNTS WERE PAID AND THE AMOUNT ACCRUED WAS $53,088.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ON WHICH THIS FORM 990 IS BASED WERE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AT ITS DECEMBER 2018 MEETING. A DRAFT OF THE FORM 990 WAS PROVIDED TO ALL TRUSTEES PRIOR TO BEING FILED. ANY CHANGES OR COMMENTS RESULTING FROM THEIR REVIEW ARE THEN REFLECTED IN THE FORM 990 PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS OF THE CORNERSTONE BOARD ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE POSSIBLE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ANNUALLY BY SIGNING THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. ADDITIONALLY, THE ORGANIZATION USES A GROUP PURCHASING ORGANIZATION THAT MONITORS POSSIBLE CONFLICTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OF THE CORNERSTONE FOUNDATION IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT AS WELL AS THE SELECTION AND RECOMMNEDATION OF THE INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT TO THE BOARD FOR ITS APPROVAL ON BEHALF OF THE ORGANIZATION.
